page.title: 17Chatteris - Factory Fire
page.content:
On Wednesday 19th June, 1985 the potato packing factory in New Road, Chatteris, caught on fire. It started in the canteen only minutes after the production line workers had left to begin their 8.00am shift.
The Production Line Manager, Mr David Baxter said he was pleased at the speed with which everyone got out of the building. People did not panic, leaving the building in a sensible way. This he said made it easy to check that the building was clear.
The Fire Brigade arrived very quickly and took about half an hour to bring the fire under control.
Mr Baxter hoped production would start again as soon as possible.
